|rad1chip2 = Broadcom;BCM2050; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = 9 |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== OEM [[Gemtek]] WRTB-133G (WRTB-133G_V00) / WRTB-134G (WRTB-134G_V01A) / WRTB-153G (WRTB-153G_V01) The default IP for the router is 192.168.11.1 operating as an AP and 192.168.11.100 operating as a bridge. The power adapter included with the device is a '''[[Buffalo]]''' US112-3320 (3.3V, 2A). ID/OD/Len measurements are approximate. ==Links of Interest== *[http://www.ibmmuseum.com/ohlandl/NIC/whr-g54s.html On '''ibmmuseum.com'''] *[https://openwrt.org/toh/buffalo/whr-g54s On the '''OpenWrt''' Wiki] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = v23 SP2 :initial flash: use [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/TFTP flash|Tftp flash]] Please insert instructions here ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrtNotice|notrecommended}} {{OpenWrtNotice|insufficient}} {{OpenWrtNotice|endsupport|2022|19.07.10}} {{OpenWrtNotice|broadcomwifi}} {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/buffalo/buffalo_whr-g54s |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/buffalo/whr-g54s |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = 10.03.1 |current_supported_version = 10.03.1 |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ===Flashing Tomato=== Please insert instructions here ==Pictures==
